did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, photographs, printed materials, speeches, publications, research material
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes correspondence, publications, research files, speeches, photographs, including promotional photographs of meals with his products made of fish, eggs and poultry.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Baker earned a bachelor's degree from Cornell University in 1943 and then went on to major in Pomology at Cornell's College of Agriculture. He received his master's degree at Penn State University and his doctorate at Purdue University. He was a professor at Cornell from 1957-1989. In 1970 he founded Cornell's Institute of Food Science and Marketing. Baker was elected a fellow of the Institute of Food Technologists in 1997.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, publications, research files, speeches, photographs, including promotional photographs of meals with his products made of fish, eggs and poultry.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York College of Agriculture. Department of Food Science

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Robert Baker papers, #21-26-4030. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Reprints and Photographs of products, exhibits, trips, equipment, etc.
Photographs of products, exhibits, trips, equipment, etc. and Research Files
Research Files and Alphabetical Subject Files and Correspondence "A"
Alphabetical Subject Files and Correspondence "B" - "F" including photos of Bob Baker
Alphabetical Subject Files and Correspondence "R" - "Z"; Newspaper Articles, Biographical files; Speeches; Information Notebooks (1979-1980); Day Calendar (1986)
